intro: Gemella, commonly known as the "buttercup" or "false buttercup," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, often yellow or orange flowers with five petals and numerous stamens. Gemella species are typically found in moist, temperate regions and often grow in meadows or along stream banks. They have alternate, simple leaves that are usually lobed or serrated. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value.
